intro: Cicerbita polyclada, commonly known as the clustered bittercress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lobed, and often have a slightly bitter taste. Cicerbita polyclada is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and woodland edges.
